channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Football's hottest young prospect has confirmed reports he is set to re-sign with the Gold Coast AFL club.
item.title: Rowell commits long-term future to Suns

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: The impact of the Vietnam War on African-Americans is a subject worth exploring, but this overlong, sometimes lurid drama isn't one of Spike Lee's best.
item.title: Spike Lee's Vietnam drama suffers from overkill

item.description: The Indian Army has raised the death toll in a clash with Chinese troops on a disputed Himalayan border from three to 20 Indian soldiers.
item.title: India blames China, says border casualties could have been avoided

item.description: An inquest into the death of a Brisbane mother Cindy Miller will look at whether police watchhouse procedures are adequate.
item.title: Inquest into mother's death at a Queensland watchhouse

item.description: The American sprinter, in a lengthy statement on Twitter, said he could be hit with a ban from the athletics integrity unit after missing a test on December 9.
item.title: World 100m champ facing possible doping ban after whereabouts failure

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Simon Birmingham argues the new agreement will help counter the damaging "lure" of protectionism taking hold around the globe.
item.title: Australia launches UK free trade agreement with a warning about protectionism

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The grieving parents of a teenager stabbed to death outside a suburban shopping centre have vowed to forgive their son's killers.
item.title: 'We want our son back': Teen's grieving parents vow to forgive son's killers

item.description: As European nations turn to unproven technology to avoid a second wave of infection, debate has emerged about how to fight the virus while safeguarding privacy.
item.title: Europe rolls out contact tracing apps

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Rod Roberts was promoted after he told the upper house of his planned motion around Aboriginal deaths in custody, stating that "the truth matters".
item.title: One Nation MP secures role after planned motion around Aboriginal deaths in custody

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Brisbane City Council's popular kerbside collection program will be suspended for two years.
item.title: Brisbane City Council budget at a glance: Winners and losers

item.dc:creator: Sandra Hall
item.description: Artemis Fowl is a 12-year-old “criminal mastermind” whose black suit, tie and sunglasses make him look as if he’s auditioning for a role as an apprentice in Men in Black.
item.title: This Artemis is neither fish nor fowl

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: The world's largest miner, BHP, has recruited biotech giant CSL's David Lamont to become its chief financial officer, replacing the long-serving Peter Beaven.
item.title: BHP taps CSL's CFO to replace veteran Peter Beaven

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: A medical services provider criticised in an inquest over its care of two revellers who died after taking drugs at Defqon.1 hired a convicted child sex offender in a managerial role last year.
item.title: Defqon.1 medics hired child sex offender

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas is considering moving some of its Airbus A380s into long-term storage in the Californian desert ahead of a possible early retirement for the superjumbos.
item.title: Plane boneyards: Qantas looking at moving A380s into 'deep storage' in the Californian desert

item.description: Jason Taumalolo says his North Queensland teammates are feeling the heat and only wins will ease the mounting pressure on coach Paul Green.
item.title: Winning 'will ease pressure' on Cowboys and coach Green

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge has defended his decisions at the selection table as the winless Dogs prepare to face the Giants on Friday night.
item.title: Beveridge defends selection, Liberatore in mix to face Giants

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: If the latest oil forecasts prove accurate, we can forget optimistic projections of "V-shaped" recoveries for the global economy.
item.title: Oil's bleak outlook is bad news for the global economy

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Possibly fatal rail accident avoided last month when out-of control Ballarat train that would have been full of football supporters hit level crossing gates.
item.title: Deadly train crash averted thanks to footy shutdown and 'luck factor'

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Around a dozen witnesses testified at trial they saw Ciara Glennon walking alone on Stirling Highway looking for a taxi before she was last seen leaning into a white station wagon and talking to the driver.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: State recounting final moments Ciara Glennon was seen alive

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Former ICC boss Malcolm Speed says Kevin Roberts' poor relationships with the game's stakeholders cost him his job as Cricket Australia chief.
item.title: 'He lost trust and respect': Speed's stinging assessment of Roberts

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: 'So was he just a rapist, or was he a rapist and a murderer?', state prosecutor Carmel Barbagallo asked the Supreme Court of Western Australia as she continues in her final bid to convict Bradley Edwards of the Claremont serial killings.
item.title: ‘He was coming back for her’: Security guard interrupted accused Claremont serial killer's first murder, state claims

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Alastair Clarkson says Hawthorn will stay the course with Ben McEvoy in defence as the Hawks look to their midfield to turn things around against Richmond.
item.title: Hawks to stay the course with McEvoy

item.description: The parks are preparing to reopen with strict coronavirus safety measures to protect visitors and staff in place.
item.title: Queensland theme parks ready to reopen

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Police have charged Porsche driver Richard Pusey with committing an act outraging public decency and behaving in an indecent or offensive manner, in relation to the crash that killed four police officers.
item.title: Further charges laid against Richard Pusey following Eastern Freeway crash

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Lord mayor Adrian Schrinner has handed down his second budget, losing $142 million in revenue.
item.title: Six-month rates freeze as Brisbane budget braces for impact

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Inside British racing's most exuberant event of year, where royal staff are sworn to secrecy and fascinators are frowned upon.
item.title: 'We think we're wild': How Royal Ascot compares to the spring carnival

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: When my usual emotional crutches didn't work, I turned to an unexpected alternative to help survive the chaos of COVID-19.
item.title: How a '70s boy band got me through lockdown

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland's October state election will go ahead even if a second wave of coronavirus lashes the state with COVID-safe planning underway.
item.title: Queensland 'will have an election period, not just an election day'

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The Australian Cricketers’ Association has scored a major victory, with Cricket Australia abandoning plans to shorten the Sheffield Shield season.
item.title: Cricket Australia abandons plans to shorten Sheffield Shield

item.description: The four-time Hawthorn premiership player will be wearing a Brisbane guernsey on Saturday against West Coast in a milestone game a long time coming.
item.title: Birchall eyes second AFL life in Brisbane

item.description: After 46 years, I want to move from being an icon to an iconoclast. Year after year, companies inflict harm against black culture while actively gouging it for inspiration.
item.title: I was the first black model on Vogue's cover. I now propose a new rule

item.description: Amazon is now using software in its warehouses to automatically warn employees when they're too close to colleagues, the latest effort by the retailing giant to adjust its facilities to life with the coronavirus.
item.title: Amazon deploys new social-distancing software at its warehouses

item.description: Lionel Messi's Barcelona extended their La Liga lead over bitter rivals Real Madrid after overcoming a slow start to beat lowly Leganes 2-0 at the Nou Camp.
item.title: Messi scores as Barcelona go five points clear in La Liga

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A small number of Queensland footy fans will be allowed back into stadiums from this weekend.
item.title: Stadiums open to Queensland fans at weekend 'trial run'

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The Premier says he will 'break the business model' of branch stackers and make sure the voice of genuine Labor members is 'louder than it has ever been'.
item.title: Labor Party review will return power to 'true believers': Andrews

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: In a letter to Equestrian Australia directors, the Australian Sports Commission says it had no choice but to take the unprecedented action of calling in administrators to enact governance reform.
item.title: Why ASC had to take reins and force equestrian into administration

item.description: Violence has surged between the Western-backed alliance and the Houthi group after a six-week ceasefire prompted by the coronavirus pandemic expired last month.
item.title: Violence surges in Yemen after coronavirus truce expires

item.description: The bodies of two people missing in the ocean off Coral Bay in WA’s North West have been found after the boat they were on sank on Tuesday evening.
item.title: Two people found dead after boat sinks off Coral Bay

item.description: Coach Anthony Seibold says it's time the Tongan international repaid their faith by finding a way to stay on the field while keeping his trademark aggression.
item.title: Pangai set for Broncos balancing act

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Twenty-one new cases of coronavirus have been recorded in Victoria in the past day, 15 of whom are returned travellers being quarantined in a hotel.
item.title: Aged care resident and hotel worker among 21 new COVID-19 cases

item.description: People are less willing to fly now than they were at the height of the coronavirus lockdown, according to research carried out for the airline industry's main trade group.
item.title: Confidence in travel slides further, with less than half willing to fly

item.description: During Marilyn Booker's 26-year career at Morgan Stanley, she often felt that too few of its employees were black. She was still trying to rectify the situation on the morning she was fired.
item.title: 'My story is the same as many black people on Wall Street': Morgan Stanley’s former diversity chief is suing the company

item.description: Former NBA executive Bryan Colangelo has purchased a stake in the NBL's Illawarra Hawks, who will now be known simply as the Hawks.
item.title: Former 76ers executive buys stake in NBL's Hawks

item.description: We've got you covered with everything you need to know for a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Warwick Farm on Wednesday

item.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews is holding a press conference. You can watch it here.
item.title: Watch now: Premier Daniel Andrews is addressing the media

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 opened higher, but is wavering between positive and negative territory today.
item.title: Afterpay steps over $58, ASX see-saws

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, June 17

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: Wage theft will become a crime in Victoria after the state’s upper house passed Australia’s first legislation making the deliberate underpayment of wages a criminal offence.
item.title: Wage theft to become a crime as Victoria's parliament passes new laws

item.description: Jackson Irvine is one of four out-of-contract players who have failed to agree short-term extensions with Hull.
item.title: Socceroo Irvine leaves Hull before Championship restart

item.description: Brazil also registered 1282 COVID-19 deaths since its last update on Monday, the Health Ministry said, bringing confirmed fatalities in the country to 45,241.
item.title: Brazil reports record 34,918 new coronavirus cases in a day
